content.question: Copper consists of two naturally occurring isotopes, one with <math alttext="34" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>34</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> neutrons and one with <math alttext="36" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>36</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> neutrons. Which of the following is the mass spectrum of a representative sample of <math alttext="C u" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The figure presents a bar graph with two bars of data. The horizontal axis is labeled Atomic Mass, in atomic mass units, and the numbers 32 through 37 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled Percent Abundance, and the numbers 0 through 100, in increments of 10, are indicated. The values of the two bars are as follows. Bar 1: 34 atomic mass units, 50 percent abundance. Bar 2: 36 atomic mass units, 50 percent abundance.

The figure presents a bar graph with two bars of data. The horizontal axis is labeled Atomic Mass, in atomic mass units, and the numbers 61 through 66 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled Percent Abundance, and the numbers 0 through 100, in increments of 10, are indicated. The values of the two bars are as follows. Bar 1: 63 atomic mass units, 50 percent abundance. Bar 2: 65 atomic mass units, 50 percent abundance.

The figure presents a bar graph with two bars of data. The horizontal axis is labeled Atomic Mass, in atomic mass units, and the numbers 32 through 37 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled Percent Abundance, and the numbers 0 through 100, in increments of 10, are indicated. The values of the two bars are as follows. Bar 1: 34 atomic mass units, 69 percent abundance. Bar 2: 36 atomic mass units, 31 percent abundance.

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
